bullets.text: Fed finalized 2026 bank stress-test scenarios and kept current stress-test capital requirements unchanged pending public feedback.
ADP shows private payrolls rose only 22,000 in January, signaling labor-market cooling and raising recession-risk chatter.
January jobs report delayed to Feb. 11 due to government shutdown, increasing near-term macro uncertainty and market volatility.
Oil prices whipsawed as U.S.-Iran talks alternately raised de-escalation hopes and collapse fears, highlighting geopolitical risk premia in crude.
China’s Xi pressed Trump on Taiwan in a call, underscoring persistent flashpoint risk for U.S.-China relations and supply chains.
China escalated threats tied to a Panama Canal-related ruling seen as a Trump win, signaling broader strategic pressure on trade chokepoints.
Trump administration delayed hundreds of wind and solar projects, increasing policy risk for U.S. clean-energy buildout and associated capital deployment.
Private credit, once a Wall Street darling, is “starting to crack,” raising concerns about hidden leverage, refinancing risk, and spillovers to banks and markets.
Alphabet/Google plans to sharply increase AI infrastructure spending, resetting capex expectations and intensifying the compute arms race across big tech.
Tech selloff broadened: AMD plunged on guidance concerns; Qualcomm and Arm fell post-earnings, showing elevated expectations and fragility in AI-adjacent valuations.
Hedge funds profited $24B shorting software in 2026 and are increasing bets, reflecting skepticism about SaaS pricing power amid AI-driven disruption.
Science warns melting Antarctic ice could weaken a major carbon sink, implying faster atmospheric CO2 accumulation and higher long-run climate-economic damages.
